abaxial.definition: located on the lower side of a branch; facing away from an axis or branch. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

accessory.definition: in addition to; also, appended to a main or central structure ( e.g., accessory branches in red algae in addition to vegetative ones). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

accessory pigment.definition: a pigment other than chlorophyll "a;' but functioning in photosynthesis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

acellular.definition: not made up of distinct cells or lacking cross walls (see coenocyte). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

acroblastic branching.definition: initials for this type of branching originate from (partsof) small lenticular segments of the apical cells of erect filaments (see p. 13 and fig. 9). (source: Prud’Homme van Reine, W. F. (1982). A taxonomic revision of the European Sphacelariaceae (Sphacelariales, Phaeophyceae). Leiden Botanical Series, 6(1), 3-293.).

acrochaetioid.definition: resembling the genus acrochaetium, a microscopic, filamentous, branched or unbranched (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

acroheteroblastic branching.definition: two different types of structures are formed from the lenticular initial cell (fig. 9). (source: Prud’Homme van Reine, W. F. (1982). A taxonomic revision of the European Sphacelariaceae (Sphacelariales, Phaeophyceae). Leiden Botanical Series, 6(1), 3-293.).

acrohomoblastic branching.definition: only one type of structure is formed from the lenticular initial cell (fig. 9). (source: Prud’Homme van Reine, W. F. (1982). A taxonomic revision of the European Sphacelariaceae (Sphacelariales, Phaeophyceae). Leiden Botanical Series, 6(1), 3-293.).

acronematic.definition: a flagellum that lacks mastigonemes. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

acropetal.definition: proceeding from the base or below it toward the apex. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

aculeate.definition: prickly or spine-like; also having processes resembling prickles or spines. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

acuminate.definition: tapered gradually to a pointed tip (see acute). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

acute.definition: ending abruptly in a sharp point or spine (see acuminate). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ad pressed.definition: lying flat for the whole length of the organ. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

adaxial.definition: on the side or face next to the main axis of a branch; towards the axis on the upper side of a branch (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

adeloparasite.definition: a parasite that infects a related host species (versus alloparasite). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

adelphoparasite.definition: a parasite that is closely related to its host; cf. alloparasite (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

adherent.definition: sticking fast to an object or surface. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

adjoined.definition: joined together, weakly or tightly; said of filaments. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

adnate.definition: attached or fused to another structure; pertaining to unlike parts that grow together. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

adventitious.definition: arising in an irregular manner or from an abnormal site. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

adventive.definition: not native or lately introduced. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

adventive rhizoids.definition: rhizoids formed in an abnormal position or manner. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

aegagropilous.definition: in the form of an unattached clump, generally spherical and free rolling; branches radiate from the center and are usually intermeshed. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

aerobtastie.definition: when branches originate from small lenticular segments of the apical cells (in sphacelariales). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

agamospore.definition: a spore formed by mitotic cleavage of blade cells, without fertilisation, and germinating into conchocelis. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

agamospores.definition: in the bangiales, spores formed by mitotic cleavage of blade cells; formed without fertilization and growing into a conchocelis stage. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

agar.definition: a phycocolloid; a sulfated polysaccharide (i.e., a galactan) found in the cell walls and intercellular spaces of different rhodophyta (e.g., ahnfeltia, gelidium, gracilaria). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

agarophyte.definition: a red alga that contains agar (e.g., graci/aria spp.). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

air-bladder.definition: air-filled vesicle serving for flotation. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

akinete.definition: non-motile asexual spore, with a wall incorporated in that of the parent cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

ala.definition: a flat lateral expansion or a wing. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

alga.definition: a general term applied to any taxon of photosynthetic, usually aquatic, non-vascular plants reproducing without cellular-jacketed antheridia and oogonia. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

alginic acid.definition: a phycocolloid present in the cell walls of phaeophyta, consisting of a polysaccharide formed from β-1, 4-linked d-mannuronic acid and α-1, 4-linked l-guluronic acid units. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

aligned.definition: rows of adjacent cells with end walls at same level (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

allantoid.definition: shaped like a sausage. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

allelocysts.definition: elongated, multinucleated, thick-walled, and lateral conducting elements in some kelps and members of the phyllariaceae (see solenocysts) (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

alloparasite.definition: a parasite that is unrelated to its host; cf. adelphoparasite (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

alternate.definition: placed singly, with change of side. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

alternately branched.definition: branches appear on 2 sides of a stalk, alternating at different levels along the axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

alternation of generations.definition: the alternation of a haploid sexual gamete-producing phase with a diploid spore-producing phase. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

alternative names.definition: a taxonomic term referring to more than one name published at the same time by the same author for the same taxon. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

amoeboid.definition: moving like an amoeba. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

amorphous.definition: lacking a distinctive morphology or without a definite structure. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ampulla.definition: a cluster of filaments that produces carpogonial branches or auxiliary cells as in some members of the gigartinales. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

amyloplasts.definition: colorless starch-storing plastids. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

anastomose.definition: the fusion of adjacent parts to form a reticulum or network. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

anastomosing.definition: branched and fused into a network. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

androgynous.definition: the presence of separate male and female conceptacles in the same receptacle and thallus (see hermaphrodite). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

androphore.definition: a stalk or structure bearing male reproductive organs. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

anisogametes.definition: similar motile gametes of unequal size. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

anisogamy.definition: the fusion of two similar motile gametes of unequal size. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

annual.definition: a plant or frond lasting for only one year. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

annular.definition: ring like, as applied to ridges or ingrowth of walls (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

anterior.definition: towards the front or apex of a structure. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

antheridium.definition: male reproductive organ, producing gametes. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

antherozoid.definition: a male gamete. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

anticlinal.definition: at right angles to the surface. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

antidinal.definition: organized at right angles (perpendicular) to a designated surface. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

apex.definition: the tip or point of a structure, (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

apical.definition: relating to the apex or top. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

apical cell.definition: terminal initial cell of a filament or thallus. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

apical growth.definition: growth occurring at the apex of an axis or branch. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

apical margin.definition: margin of plant entirely comprising apical cells. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

apiculate.definition: ending abruptly in short point (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

aplanosporangium.definition: a sporangium containing a non-motile spore (aplanospore) which germinates directly into a filament (e.g. in vaucheria). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

aplanospore.definition: a nonmotile spore produced from and separate from its vegetative mother cell (see akinetes). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

apomeiosis.definition: the formation of spores without meiosis. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

apomeiotic.definition: formation of reproductive cells without meiosis. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

apomictic.definition: reproducing asexually, without karyogamy and meiosis (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

apomixis.definition: asexual reproduction that lacks meiosis or fusion of gametes. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

apomorphous.definition: a derived state of expression of a character (source: Algaebase (2021-05)).

apophysis.definition: a tapering transition zone between stipe and blade. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

appendage.definition: a lateral, usually irregularly positioned, short structure on an organ. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

applanate.definition: flattened in one plane (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

apposed.definition: arranged side by side. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

appressed.definition: pressed together without being united (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

archeosporangia.definition: in members of the bangiales a single celled sporangium (i.e., a mother cell) that produces archeospores. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

archeospore.definition: a spore formed by differentiation of a vegetative cell which releases a single cell product that germinates into the blade/foliose phase. previously referred to as a monospore (see nelson et al. 1999). (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

arcuate.definition: bent like a bow; spermatangial systems in melobesioideae (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

articulate.definition: segmented, jointed, or appearing as segmented, flexible branches (e.g., some members of the red algal order corallinales). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ascocyst.definition: an abnormal enlarged, hyaline, or darkly staining cell, usually empty when old. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

ascocysts.definition: a unicellular, hyaline, paraphyses-like structure in brown algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

asexual.definition: no sexual fusion in reproduction (see apomictic). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

assimilating filament.definition: photosynthetic filaments, hairs, or branches. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

assimilatory.definition: filaments or cells which contain photosynthetic plastids. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

assurgent.definition: curving obliquely upward or ascending; horizontal filaments that turn upward. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

astipitate.definition: not having a stipe. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

asymmetric.definition: being uneven or lacking symmetry. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

attenuate.definition: slender, thin, tapering. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

auctorum non..definition: taxonomic latin term "of authors"; used in conjunction with nec or non for a misapplied name. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

auriculate.definition: ear-shaped. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

author.definition: a taxonomic term describing the person(s) whose name(s) or publication is attributed. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

autospore.definition: nonmotile spores produced in parent cells that develop the same shape as the parent cell at an early stage before release. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

auxiliary cell.definition: a specialized cell in the red algal class florideophyceae that receives the diploid nucleus, or its division products, from a fertilized carpogonium and often gives rise to gonimoblasts (see central cell). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

auxocaulic.definition: growth of axes or branches by enlargement of medullary cells (e.g. cladostephaceae). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

auxocaulous.definition:
describing species of sphacelariales (phaeophyta) whose primary tissues broaden after they are formed; also meaning, growth of an axis or branches by enlargement of medullary cells (cf. auxocaulus & leptocaulous)- e.g. the brown alga cladostephus (sphacelariales) 
 (source: Algaebase (2021-05)).

awn.definition: a sharp, usually moderately elongate, terminal or lateral projection. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

axial.definition: pertaining to the axis or central core of a branch. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

axial cell.definition: one cell of axial filament, sometimes distinguishable among medullary cells in transverse section of axes. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

axial conceptacle.definition: a medullary conceptacle originating in line with and terminating the axis of a branch; in the corallinoideae (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

axial filament.definition: the central filament of a thallus or its branch. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

axil.definition: the angle between the axis and a lateral branch or organ. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

axile.definition: pertaining to an axis; situated around or along an axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

axillary.definition: situated on, in, or from an axil. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

bacilloid.definition: resembling bacteria, minute and elongate. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

bar code.definition: one or more short gene sequences taken from a standardized portion of the genome and used to identify an organism. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

barrel-shaped.definition: cylindrical, with slightly convex sides and flat ends. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

basal cell.definition: lower cell (also called foot cell) formed by division of auxiliary cell into two. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

basal filaments.definition: unistratose, basal layer of thallus filaments (figs 1; 2a); in dimerous plants (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

basionym.definition: the original name of a taxon (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

basipetal.definition: developing from the apex toward the base the youngest structures are nearest the base. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

benthic.definition: attached to or living on the sea bottom. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

bifid.definition: divided into 2, usually by a v-shaped notch. (source: Hiscock Brown).

biflagellate.definition: having 2 flagella. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bifurcate.definition: divided into two branches or forks. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

bilateral.definition: branching in 2 ranks on opposite sides of an axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

binary.definition: a taxonomic term consisting of a generic name and a specific epithet. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

binary fission.definition: simple division of a unicell into two parts/unicells. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

binucleate.definition: with two nuclei. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

biogenic.definition: originating from living matter (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

biogeography.definition: the study of the geographical distribution of organisms. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

biphasic.definition: having two life history phases. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

bipinnate.definition: when both primary and secondary divisions are pinnate. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bipolar.definition: having two poles each with development in one direction. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

biseriate.definition: arranged in two rows or series. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

bisexual.definition: with both sex organs produced within the one structure or thallus. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

bisporangium.definition: a sporangium whose contents divide to form two spores; cf. tetrasporangium (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

bispore.definition: one of two spores released from a bisporangium. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

bisporophyte.definition: phase of life history that forms bisporangia. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

bistratose.definition: having two layers; cf. unistratose (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

bistromatic.definition: a blade composed of 2 layers of cells (see distromatic). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bladder.definition: a vesicle or small sac-like float that aids in buoyancy (see air bladder, vesicle). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

blade.definition: flat (leaf-like) part of thallus. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

blade phase.definition: the macroscopic, gametophyte stage. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

bladelet.definition: a small blade, often specialized for reproduction. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

blastn.definition: a molecular tool used in nucleotide basic local alignment search. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

brachyblasts.definition: specialized determinate branches that arise from axial cells and are involved in vegetative propagation and dispersal (e.g., spyridia). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

brackish.definition: part seawater and part freshwater (i.e., diluted seawater); also refers to stable low salinities as in the baltic sea. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bract.definition: a modified lateral branchlet usually with reproductive organs in its axil. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

bract cell.definition: a spine-like cell that occurs at branchlet nodes in species of the characeae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bracteole.definition: in the characeae, a spine-like process that develops from cells of an antheridial lateral and appears to subtend the oogonium. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

branch.definition: a main lateral appendage of the axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

branching.definition: can be of several main types; those mentioned in the key are illustrated below: (source: Hiscock Brown).

branchlet.definition: a small secondary branch that is usually the final part of a branch system. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bristle.definition: a stiff hair or needle-like spine (see setae). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bulbous.definition: shaped like a bulb or having a swollen aspect. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bulla.definition: having blisters or bulging of a thallus surface. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

bullate.definition: with a bulging or puckering of the surface. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

buried conceptacle.definition: old conceptacle that becomes covered over by continued thallus growth, but not infilled (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

bushy.definition: a dense, much branched, thallus or part thereof. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

byssal threads.definition: in mussels (e.g., mytilus edulis), strong, silky proteinaceous fibers that are used for attachment to rocks or other substrata. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

byssoid.definition: consisting of fine threads. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

caducous.definition: not persistent (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

caecostoma.definition: in fucales, a pit lacking hairs or ostiole. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

caespitose.definition: tufted or with tufts of hairs. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

calcareous.definition: impregnated or containing lime or calcium carbonate; stony. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

calcification.definition: deposition of calcium carbonate in or on cell walls of the thallus. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

calcified.definition: encrusted or impregnated with lime. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

calcite.definition: hexagonal, rhombohedral crystals of calcium carbonate in the walls of vegetative cells (fig. 4) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

canaliculate.definition: thalli with a channel or groove (e.g., mastocarpus). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cap cell.definition: a single cell at the apex of a filament; it often has a unique shape. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

capillary.definition: slender, hair-like. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

capitate.definition: with a distinct head (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

carotene.definition: pigments with oxygen-free, unsaturated hydrocarbons that are fat soluble and reflect yellow, orange, or red light. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

carotenoid.definition: a general term for carotenes and xanthophyll pigments, which are long hydrocarbon molecules with terminal benzene rings. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

carotenoids.definition: orange-yellow isoprenoid polyene pigments containing carbon and hydrogen, present in phaeoplasts. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

carpogonial branch.definition: filament bearing the female gametangium, the carpogonium (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

carpogonium.definition: female sexual cell, consisting of a basal portion, the contents of which function as the gamete, and an elongated apical receptive portion, the trichogyne. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

carposporangium.definition: sporangium formed by gonimoblast tissue. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

carpospore.definition: spore released from carposporangium. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

carposporophyte.definition: the diploid, partially parasitic phase attached to the female gametophyte in the triphasic red algae life history; it develops by mitotic divisions of the zygotic nucleus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

carpostome.definition: the opening of a cystocarp in some red algae through which its spores are discharged. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

carpotetrasporangium.definition: a sporangium that produces 4 spores (carpotetraspores) via meiosis in place of carpospores in most red algae (see gymnogongrus). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

carrageenan.definition: a phycocolloid or the sulfated polysaccharide found in the cell walls of some red algae (e.g., chondrus, eucheuma, and hypnea). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cartilaginous.definition: with a tough texture rather like cartilage. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

catenate.definition: in a series or connected in series. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cell wall.definition: non-living rigid structure surrounding the plasma membrane of cells. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

cellulose.definition: linear polysaccharide made up of glucose residues joined by b, 1, 4 linkages. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

central cell.definition: a cell of an axial filament in polysiphonous red algae (see axial cell). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cervicorn.definition: with branching more or less one-sided or with unequal forks ( e.g., deer-like antler horns). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

chlorophyll.definition: fat soluble, green, photosynthetic pigments, consisting of closed tetrapyrrols with magnesium. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

chromist.definition: a eukaryotic super group that is probably polyphyletic and treated as a separate kingdom or included in the protista. the group includes all algae with chloroplast containing chlorophylls “a” and “c.” the organelles are surrounded by 4 membranes. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

chrysolaminaran.definition: the storage product of most chrysophyta, consisting largely of β-1, 3- glucopyranoside units. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

cicatrigenous.definition: arising from a scar cell or a basal remnant of a trichoblast. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

clade.definition: a group of organisms descended from a common ancestor; also a branch of a cladogram. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cladophoroid.definition: similar to the green algal genus cladophora. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

class.definition: a taxonomic term describing the category of taxa intermediate between phylum (division) and order. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

clathrate.definition: club-shaped. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

clavate.definition: club-shaped. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

clone.definition: a group of individuals formed by vegetative reproduction from a single original parent. coalescent (coalesced). joined or fused together. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

coalesce.definition: uniting or merging by growing together. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

coalescence.definition: fusion of main and lateral axes over a number of segments (e.g. in pterosiphonia). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

coaxial.definition: with cells laterally aligned in curving rows (fig.97b) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

coccoid.definition: single-celled and rounded. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

coenobium.definition: a well-defined group of individual cells, usually with a distinct morphology held together by a common mucilage (see colony). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

coenocyte.definition: a multinucleate cell or thallus that lacks cross walls (acellular). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

coenocytic.definition: large (usually elongate) multinucleate cells, without cross walls in vegetative parts. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

colonial.definition: a group of individuals united in a common life, but not forming a single organism. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

colony.definition: group of individuals of the same species living together in close proximity, sometimes forming an aggregate structure with organic connections between the individual members. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

columella.definition: filamentous, sometimes calcified structure often occurring in the centre of the floor of a tetra/ bisporangial conceptacle (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

combinatio nova.definition: latin meaning a "new combination (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

complanate.definition: flattened or branching in one plane (compressed and dilated). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

compressed.definition: slightly flattened laterally; elliptical in cross section. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

concatenate.definition: linked together like a string of beads (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

concave.definition: curving in or hollowed inward. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

concavity.definition: depression on thallus or conceptacle surface formerly occupied by an epithallial cell (sem) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

concentric.definition: having a common center. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

conceptacle.definition: an enclosed chamber opening outwards, which contains reproductive structures (no homology with conceptacles in different algal groups is implied) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

conceptacle primordium.definition: a group of meristematic cells from which a conceptacle develops (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

conchocelis.definition: a morphological phase in the life history consisting of endolithic filaments; confined to the bangiophycidae. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

conchosporangia.definition: the sporangia of the endophytic shell-boring "conchocelis" that produces conchospores. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

conchosporangial branch.definition: differentiated filament distinguished by colour, shape and branching in which conchospores develop; released conchospores germinate to form the blade/foliose phase. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

conchospore.definition: typically a haploid spore produced from the conchocelis stage of bangialean red algae, which develops into a foliose gametophyte. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

confluence.definition: where two adjacent thalli meet (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

confluent.definition: running together; cf. discrete (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

connate.definition: united or fused. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

connecting cell.definition: cell that links two structures and usually carries a nucleus, e.g. after fertilization of carpogonium. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

connecting filament.definition: in advanced red algae, a filament that transfers the zygote nucleus, or one of its derivatives, from the fertilized carpogonium to a nutritive or auxiliary cell (also known as an ooblast). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

conservation.definition: the decision by the international botanical congress that a validly published name shall be used that is contrary to the general rules. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

conspecific.definition: belonging to or identical with another taxon. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

constricted.definition: narrow regions lying between swollen or larger regions. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

contiguous.definition: adjacent; used particularly to denote the proximity of different filaments whose cells are aligned or secondarily joined by fusions or secondary pit connections (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

contorted.definition: with branches or axes that are irregular, twisted, or deformed. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

convex.definition: rounded outward; like the outside of a sphere. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

convolute.definition: partly inrolled from the margin. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

coplanar.definition: in the same plane (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

copula.definition: a small cup-shaped structure. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

corallinaceous.definition: resembling a coralline alga in structure. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

coralline.definition: primarily referring to lime-encrusted or calcareous red algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

coralloid.definition: having slender, erect, nearly straight branches. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cordate.definition: heart-shaped. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

core.definition: central tissue or central filaments that generally run parallel to the surface (see also medulla). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

coriaceous.definition: leathery. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

corneous.definition: made of a horn or horn-like substance, similar to that of horns or hooves of some mammals. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cornute.definition: horned, like a crown with horns; also pointed or spiny. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

corona.definition: in the characeae, a group of tiny cells at the tip of a branchlet formed by reduction of the end cell and bract cells. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

coronula.definition: in characeae, a miniature "crown" at the upper end of an oogonium; the end cells that enclose and cover the oogonium. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

corrugate.definition: having small wrinkles or folds. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cortex.definition: collective term for filaments derived from subepithallial initials, occurring externally to the medulla (fig.2c) and running more or less at right angles to the thallus surface; in monomerous plants (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

cortical band.definition: ring of periaxial cells, with varying amounts of cortical tissue, formed around nodes (e.g. in ceramium). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

cortical disc.definition: thick white disc shed by some conceptacles; in melobesioideae; cf. veil (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

corticate.definition: with an outer covering of cells, rhizoids, or filaments. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

corticated.definition: having a cortex (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

corticating band.definition: a nodal band in some species of ceramiaceae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

corymb.definition: a flat-topped cluster of branches. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

corymbose.definition: with reproductive bodies borne at same level (fig.17c) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

cosmopolitan.definition: widely distributed in all or most oceans of the world. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

costa.definition: an elongate central thickening to a branch; a midrib. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

costate.definition: with a costa or midrib. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

cover cell.definition: a cell cut off by a pericentral cell (e.g., polysiphonia); also used to describe the epithelium in crustose coralline alga. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

crenate.definition: blade margins with rounded, forward-pointing teeth; also having scalloped margins. crisp (crisped). curled up near margins; crinkled, curled, undulate. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

crozier.definition: a recurved hook-shaped branch tip (a shepherd's hooked staff). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cruciate.definition: division of a tetrasporangium where the first and second cleavages are perpendicular to each other. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

crust.definition: a thin, closely adherent outwardly radiating thallus, pseudoparenchymatous in structure with laterally adjoined basal and erect filaments. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
a thallus with a 2-dimensional prostrate layer growing on a substratum. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

crustose.definition: resembling a crust; said of thalli. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

cryptic species.definition: genetically and sexually distinct species that cannot be recognized on the basis of morphology. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cryptogamic.definition: means hidden reproduction, referring to the fact that no seed is produced; thus, cryptogams represent the non-seed-bearing plants. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cryptostomata.definition: small pit or flask-shaped structures in brown algal blades, which often contain sterile hairs that extend to the surface. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

crystoliths.definition: cells containing distinctive calcium carbonate crystals; also intracellular biogenetic amorphous calcium carbonate. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cucullate.definition: hooded, like a monk's cowl. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

cuneate.definition: wedge-shaped. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

cuticle.definition: a transparent layer on the outer surface of some seaweeds. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cyst.definition: an asexual resting stage or a thick-walled cell with dense protoplasm that germinates to form a new individual; also a sac, bladder-like cell, or cavity. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cystocarp.definition: the carposporophyte and accessory enveloping tissue (pericarp) of the female gametophyte in the florideophyceae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cytokinesis.definition: vegetative division of the cytoplasm during mitosis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

cytoplasm.definition: living cell material. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

deciduous.definition: loss of branches, usually seasonally. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

decumbent.definition: growing horizontally but with extremities curving upward. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

decussate.definition: lateral branches occur in opposite pairs and each pair is at 90° to those above and below to form a 4-ranked vertical appearance. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

deltoid.definition: triangular, with approximately equal sides. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

dendroid.definition: tree-like, as a result of lower branches not developing or falling away; in spermatangial systems (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

dentate.definition: with marginal teeth. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).
with toothed margins or tooth-like projections. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

denuded.definition: left bare following loss of lateral branches. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

determinate.definition: axes with limited growth potential (e.g., branchlets). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

diaphragm.definition: a thin partition of cells across a hollow space (see also septa). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

dichotomic splitting.definition: decay during burial results in progressive separation of a thallus to form moss-like carpets in fucoid algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

dichotomous.definition: with 2 equal branches at each fork. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

dichotomy.definition: division by means of an apical cell so that forked branching occurs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

diffuse.definition: growth in almost any part of the thallus, not localised. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

diffuse growth.definition: cell divisions without a distinct meristem. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

digitate.definition: blades partially divided like the fingers of a hand. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

dimerous.definition: a type of thallus construction involving two sets of filaments (basal and erect) more or less at right angles to one another (fig.2a); cf. monomerous (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

dimorphic.definition: occurring in two morphological forms. (also = heteromorphic). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

dimorphous.definition: having 2 different forms or features. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

dinoflagellate.definition: a unicellular, usually planktonic but sometimes benthic, organism with 2 flagella (as in the phylum dinophyta). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

dioecious.definition: male and female gametangia on separate thalli. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

diplohaplontic.definition: with separate multicellular diploid (sporophyte) and haploid (gametophyte) generations. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

diploid.definition: with two sets of chromosomes in each nucleus. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

diploidisation.definition: formation of a diploid thallus by other than normal fertilisation. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

diploidization.definition: becoming diploid, usually by fusion of two haploid gametes (syngamy). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

diplont.definition: a life history in which the alga is diploid with gametes being the only haploid cells. direct life history. reproduction of the same phase of a potential life history by means of asexual spores, vegetative propagation, or propagules. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

diplontic.definition: when the diploid phase is prominent and the haploid phase consists only of the gametes. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

direct.definition: reproduction of the same phase of the (potential) life history by means of asexual spores, or propagules. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

disc.definition: a thin, closely adherent, often circular thallus, comprising outwardly radiating, laterally adjoined, usually synchronously extending filaments, monostromatic, or at least partly distromatic, in structure. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
a rounded, flat, adherent thallus with radiating filaments. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

discoid.definition: shaped like a solid disc that is flat and roughly circular. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

discrete.definition: individually distinct; cf. confluent (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

disposal cell.definition: cell cut off from auxiliary cell during post-fertilization development that contains a haploid nucleus (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

distal.definition: directed away from the base of a thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

distichous.definition: arranged in two opposite rows. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
branching in 2 rows or ranks on opposite sides of an axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

distromatic.definition: composed of two layers of similar cells. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

divaricate.definition: widely spreading (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

divergent.definition: spreading at a moderate angle; said of branching. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

division.definition: the highest taxonomic rank for taxa in the plant kingdom (see phylum). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

dorsal.definition: upper; cf. ventral (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

dorsiventral.definition: with distinct upper (ventral) and lower (dorsal) sides. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

drift.definition: unattached macrophytes in the water or loose lying. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ecad.definition: a morphological variant of an alga that is often given a name. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ecoform.definition: a form of a species considered to be ecologically based. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

ecorticate.definition: lacking a cortex or covering cells; the opposite of corticated. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ecostate.definition: without a costa or midrib. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

ectocarpoid.definition: having a structure which resembles that of ectocarpus; said of thalli which comprise erect, branched filaments, and plurilocular sporangia which are siliquose and multiseriate. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

eelgrass.definition: the common name for the seagrass zostera marina, a marine and estuarine flowering plant. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

egg.definition: a nonmotile female gamete that is normally larger than a sperm. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

elachistoid.definition: forming dense tufts, with free filaments above, similar to those of elachista. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

ellipsoid.definition: a solid of elliptic shape. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

elliptic.definition: shaped like an ellipse; oval with regularly rounded ends (in 2 dimensions). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

elliptical.definition: regularly oval (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

elwst.definition: extreme low water level of spring tides. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

embedded.definition: to be fixed into a surrounding mass or surrounded tightly or firmly (i.e., enveloped or enclosed). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

embryo.definition: a young multicellular organism, derived from the zygote or a spore, before differentiation into the mature organism. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

emendatus.definition: a latin term meaning "changed" and used before the name of an author who changed the description of a taxon without excluding its type. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

endemism.definition: restriction of the distribution of a taxon to a particular geographical region. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

endogenous.definition: originating within the organism or cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

endolithic.definition: living within rock or shells. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

endophyte.definition: an organism living within the tissues of a host plant. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).
growing within the tissues or sheath of an alga. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

endophytic.definition: growing within a plant; cf. semi-endophytic; epiphytic (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

endoplasmic reticulum.definition: an extensive system of membranes in eukaryotic cells, dividing the cytoplasm into compartments and channels; those parts containing many ribosomes are called 'rough er' and those lacking ribosomes are called 'smooth er' (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

endopolyploidy.definition: becoming diploid or polyploid without syngamy, usually by failure of nuclei to separate after dna replication. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

endosporangium.definition: a sporangium containing irregularly arranged spores of indefinite number (guiry 1990) encased in a distinct envelope, formed by mitotic division of a blade cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
a sporangium with spores indefinite in number in a distinct envelope formed by mitotic division of a cell. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

endospores.definition: an asexual reproductive unit formed inside a parent cell by mitotic division of the protoplast. endozoic. growing within the cells or tissues of an animal. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

endosporic.definition: formation of spores within the sporangium wall. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

endozoic.definition: living within an animal but not parasitic. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

ensiform.definition: shaped like a broadsword. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

entire.definition: without lobes, divisions, or proliferations; having undivided margins. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

entwined.definition: entangled or intermixed. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

enveloping filaments.definition: filaments surrounding a gonimoblast. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ephemeral.definition: short-lived. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

epidermis.definition: outermost cell layer of a complex thalli (e.g., kelps). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

epilithic.definition: growing attached to an inorganic substratum (rock, stones etc.) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

epiphyte.definition: growing on another alga, but not parasitic. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

epiphytic.definition: growing on the surface of a plant; cf. endophytic (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

epithallial cell.definition: a cell formed outwardly from either a basal cell or a subepithallial initial (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

epithallus.definition: in crustose algae, the uppermost layer; also a surface tissue produced outwardly by an intercalary meristem. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

epithet.definition: a word added to a genus name to create a species name (binomial); the process can be repeated to create a varietal name, etc., e.g. erythropeltis discigera (species), erythropeltis discigera var. flustrae (variety). (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

epizoic.definition: growing on animal substrata such as shells (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

erect.definition: growing upwards away from substratum. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

erect filament.definition: filament derived from, and more or less at right angles to, a basal filament (fig.2a); in dimerous plants (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

estipitate.definition: lacking a stipe. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

eucaryotic.definition: organisms whose cells have distinct membrane-bounded nuclei or chloroplasts (in contrast to procaryotic). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

eulittoral.definition: the main intertidal zone between the sublittoral (usually dominated by large brown algae) and the littoral fringe (usually dominated by littorinid snails). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

euryhaline.definition: tolerant to a wide range of salinities. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ex parte.definition: a latin term meaning "from (by or for) one (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

excrescence.definition: a general term used for outgrowths such as lamellae, protuberances, etc. (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

exogenous.definition: formed at the surface or arising externally. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

exserted.definition: projecting beyond a usual containing structure (included). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

exsiccate.definition: dried and preserved specimens of seaweeds. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

eyespot.definition: an orange-red pigmented spot found in some motile cells; it contains hematochrome and is usually associated with a plastid. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

facultative.definition: not necessarily taking place; not a requirement. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

falcate.definition: sickle-shaped or curved and tapering from a broad base. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

false hairs.definition: hair-like, tapering, extensions of filaments (e.g. in the ectocarpaceae) with almost colourless cells and without a basal meristem (c.f phaeophycean hairs). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

family.definition: the principal category between order and genus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

fasciated.definition: coalescent; e.g. of branch systems in lithothamnion corallioides (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

fascicle.definition: a cluster or bundle, with the parts sub-parallel. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

a cluster or tuft ofbranches (branchlets) that arise near the same area on an axis; also, a dense cluster of erect axes. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

fasciculate.definition: forming a dense cluster or bundle; said of filaments or branches. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

fastigiate.definition: with conical or tapering outline (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

fenestrate.definition: having perforations or transparent areas; window-like. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

fertile.definition: bearing reproductive structures. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

filament.definition: a row of cells joined by primary pit connections (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

a branched or unbranched row of cells joined end to end; constructed of filaments. filiform. thread-like, slender, cylindrical, or resembling a filament. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

filamentous.definition: slender or thread-like, uniseriate to multiseriate. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

filiform.definition: thread-like, but thicker than above. (up to 5 mm wide in this key.) (source: Hiscock Brown).

fimbria.definition: a bordering fringe. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

fimbriate.definition: with a fringed edge or margin. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

fistulose.definition: hollow and cylindrical thalli. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

flabellate.definition: fan-like and spreading from a narrow base, or wedge-shaped. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

flaccid.definition: limp. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

flagellate.definition: bearing one or more flagella. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

flagellum.definition: long, cylindrical, cytoplasmic extensions from cells, conferring motility on the cell; structurally with 9 peripheral doublets and two central microtubular strands. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

flared.definition: a term used to describe the laterally extended periphery of the outermost wall of epithallial cells in lithothamnion, exilicrusta and members of sporolithaceae, seen as two wings in vs (fig.85c) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).
