flat thallus.definition: a thallus of generally flattened appearance lacking protuberances etc.; cf. smooth thallus which applies to microscopic features (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

fleshy.definition: succulent, firm, smooth; not slimy or gelatinous. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

flexuous.definition: bent alternately in opposite directions; zigzag. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

float.definition: an air-filled vesicle that serves for flotation as found in sargassum (see air bladder). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

floridean starch.definition: an amylopectin storage product of red algae found in granules outside the plastid. floristic. the geographical assemblage of seaweeds in a specific area. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

foliaceous.definition: leaf-like. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
leaf-like or broad and flat. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

foliose.definition: with a broad, flat blade. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

foot.definition: the penetrating part of a parasitic alga. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

foot cell.definition: lower cell formed by division of auxiliary cell into two during post-fertilization development. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

forcipate.definition: forked and incurved like crab claws. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

form.definition: a taxonomic category usually differentiated by a very minor character; the lowest taxonomic category. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

free-floating.definition: floating at or under the surface of water; not attached. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

free-living.definition: loose-lying or drift thalli. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

frond.definition: that part of the thallus other than the attachment. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

fruticose.definition: shrubby or with numerous branches. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

fucalean.definition: pertaining to the fucales in structure or reproduction. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

fucosan.definition: a substance which accumulates in cells, considered to be a by-product of metabolism which has tannin-like properties. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

fucoxanthin.definition: a brownish carotenoid pigment in plastids of brown algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

furcate.definition: forked or divided into 2, and usually in equal parts. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

fusiform.definition: spindle-shaped; elongated and tapered toward both ends. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

fusion cell.definition: a cell formed from amalgamated supporting cells, and sometimes additional cells, after presumed karyogamy, subsequently giving rise to gonimoblast filaments (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

galactan.definition: a complex carbohydrate composed of bonded sugar molecules (polysaccharides), which is found in algae, mosses, lichens, and wood. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

gametangia.definition: the sex organs which contain the gametes. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

gametangium.definition: a cell producing one or more gametes. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

gamete.definition: a sexual cell capable of uniting with another sexual cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

gametic meiosis.definition: meiosis resulting in direct formation of gametes in a diplontic life history. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

gametogenesis.definition: the process by which gametes are formed. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

gametophore.definition: the portion of an algal filament that produces gametes; also, a structure in which gametangia are formed. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

gametophyte.definition: phase of life history, either haploid or diploid, which bears gametangia. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

ganglia.definition: stellate multi-branched cells or clusters of interconnected cells in the medulla of certain red algae. gen bank. the open access sequence database for nucleotide sequences and their protein translations. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

gelatinous.definition: slimy and jelly-like (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

generation.definition: one of the two phases (gametophyte or sporophyte) in the life history of a plant. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

geniculum.definition: a group of completely or partially noncalcified cells located below every intergeniculum; in geniculate corallines (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).
an uncalcified joint in articulated coralline red algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

genus.definition: a taxonomic group of one or more related species, separable from other such groups. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

the principal category of taxa intermediate in rank between family and species. germination disc. in red algae, a group of cells that form within the original spore wall. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

germination disc.definition: pattern of cells developing within original spore wall (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

gland cell.definition: a refractive cell that may store halogenated compounds. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

globose.definition: spherical or globular. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

globule.definition: in charophyceae, a male reproductive structure (antheridium) that includes both sterile and fertile cells. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

glossy.definition: thallus texture smooth and shiny; cf. grainy, matt (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

gonimoblast.definition: only in florideophycidae; tissue which develops on the female plant after fertilization and which ultimately produces carposporangia. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
filaments in advanced red algae that arise after fertilization and produce carposporangia. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

gonimoblast filaments.definition: filaments, usually produced from fusion cell, that produce carposporangia (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

gonimoblast initial.definition: the first cell arising from a fertilized carpogonium or diploidized auxiliary cell, which develops into the gonimoblast. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

gonimolobe.definition: in red algae, an element of a gonimoblast that arises from an initial cell and produces carposporangia; usually several occur in a cystocarp. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

grainy.definition: thallus texture rough but slightly shiny; cf. glossy, matt (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

growth band.definition: an area where cell division is continual; also a localized region functioning to expand a thallus (see meristem). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

habit.definition: the morphological form of a thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

habitat.definition: the environment in which an organism lives. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

haematochrome.definition: a red- to orange-colored carotenoid pigment. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

haematoxylin.definition: stain used to show up nuclei and other cellular structures. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

hair.definition: a long, single-celled or multicellular colorless end of a filament. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

hair cell.definition: the basal cell of a hair attached to the cortex or surface. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

halophyte.definition: a salt-tolerant flowering plant. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

haplodiplont.definition: a life history with free-living diploid (sporophyte) and haploid gametophytic thalli. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

haploid.definition: with a single set of chromosomes in each nucleus. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

haplont.definition: an organism in which the vegetative stage is haploid and the zygote divides by meiosis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

haplontic.definition: when the haploid phase is prominent and the diploid phase consists only of the zygote cell. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

haplostichous.definition: thallus construction of free or consolidated filaments but lacking intercalary longitudinal cell divisions. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

haptera.definition: branched, usually relatively robust, attachment organs (especially in the laminariales and certain fucales). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

hapteroid.definition: containing lobed, branched, or finger-like extensions of a cell that can attach to adjacent structures. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

haustorial.definition: a clear absorptive or digestive parasitic filament. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

hecatonemoid.definition: said of a thallus which resembles hecatonema (discoid, distromatic). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

hemiblastic.definition: origin of lateral branches from cells below the apex with the lateral as broad as the whole length of the parent secondary segment (sphacelariales). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

hemiparasite.definition: a partial parasite that obtains some of its nourishment from its host but also by photosynthesis (e.g., vertebrata lanosa). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

hemiparasitic.definition: partially parasitic but with the parasite largely independent and photosynthetic. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

hermaphrodite.definition: having male and female organs in the same conceptacle (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

heteroblasty.definition: the formation at two morphologically different germinating patterns from spores liberated from a single sporangium. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

heterocyst.definition: see megacell and trichocyst. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

heterodynamic flagellum.definition: a flagellum with independent patterns of motion. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

heteromorphic.definition: of a life history, consisting of reproductive phases each within a different morphology. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

heteroplastidy.definition: possessing 2 kinds of plastids. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

heterothallic.definition: with gametes produced from separate thalli. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

heterotrichous.definition: thallus comprising a prostrate creeping system from which erect filaments project (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

hirsute.definition: hairy or shaggy. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

holdfast.definition: structure attaching thallus to the substratum. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

holotype.definition: either the single specimen designated in the protologue of a species by the original author to serve as the nomenclatural type; or the single specimen used by an author in originally describing a species (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

homodynamic flagella.definition: flagella that have a similar pattern of motion. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

host.definition: an organism on which another organism grows. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

hyaline.definition: colourless; transparent. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

hypacroblastic.definition: origin of laterals from cells below the apical cell, from either the full length of the parent cell (hemiblastic) or from a subdivision of the parent cell (meriblastic). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

hypha.definition: elongate, slender cells or filaments derived laterally from medullary cells (in larger brown algae). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

hypnocyst.definition: a lateral frond fragment in some filamentous brown algae that can vegetatively recycle fronds by way of internal monospores. also an encysted form by which some algae may resist adverse conditions (cold or drought). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

hypogynous cell.definition: the cell subtending a carpogonium and carrying the egg nucleus in the red algal order ceramiales. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

hypothallial filaments.definition: name sometimes used for basal filaments or medulla (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

hypothallus.definition: a basal layer of filaments in crustose algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

illegitimate.definition: a name published contrary to the botanical code or botanical rules of nomenclature. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

imbricate.definition: overlapping in series (e.g., like tiles on a roof). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

imbricating thallus.definition: thallus in which lobe-like parts of a thallus overgrow one another like tiles on a roof (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

immersed.definition: embedded within. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

immersed conceptacle.definition: conceptacle in which the roof is flush with the thallus surface (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

incertae sedis.definition: latin, meaning "of uncertain seat"; a tax.on of uncertain taxonomic position. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

incised.definition: cut sharply from the margin. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

indeterminate.definition: a branch having unlimited growth potential. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

indeterminate axis.definition: axis of potentially unlimited growth. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

indusium.definition: a sporangial covering or a membranous covering of superficial reproductive structures (see involucre). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

inflated.definition: distended with air or gases. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

initial.definition: a meristematic cell, potentially destined to divide; cf. subepithallial, terminal initials (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

insertion.definition: the point of origin or attachment of a part to its support (e.g., a branch). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

intercalary.definition: within a filament (not terminal) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

intercellular.definition: lying between cells. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

interference microscopy.definition: use of optical interference between reflections from different layers of the surface to produce colours. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

intergeniculum.definition: a calcified segment many of which make up the frond of a geniculate coralline; separated from each other by noncalcified genicula (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).
the calcified segments between the joints of an articulated coralline alga separated by noncalcified tissue. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

intergrade.definition: an intermediate form between two species or varieties. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

internode.definition: the part of an axis intermediate between 2 nodes or joints. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

intertidal.definition: growing between extreme high and low water levels; a physical term (see littoral). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

intracellular.definition: within a cell. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

intricate.definition: intertwined or entangled. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

invaginate.definition: to push the wall of a cavity or hollow organ inwards or one section of a hollow organ into another, like a glove finger pushed into itself. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

investing.definition: to cover or enwrap completely. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

involucre.definition: ring of axes that form a partial enclosure around reproductive structure (e.g. fig. 14c). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

a group of sterile cells or filaments forming a protective envelope around a reproductive structure (see indusium). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

involute.definition: with edges rolled inward or toward the upper side. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

iridescent.definition: to reflect or shimmer rainbow colors; also appearing prismatic or displaying changing colors. isodiametric. with diameters or axes of equal length (see parenchyma). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

irregular branching.definition: branching with no consistent pattern; also cells not being the same type throughout or having variable shapes and dimensions (cf. irregularly branched) (source: Algaebase (2021-05)).

isodiametric.definition: with diameters or axes of equal length. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

isogamete.definition: motile gametes similar in size and shape. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

isogametes.definition: similar motile gametes of equal size. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

isogamous.definition: with morphologically identical (usually motile) gametes. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

isogamy.definition: the fusion of two similar motile gametes of equal size. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

isolectotype.definition: a duplicate of a lectotype, q.v. (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

isomorphic.definition: of a life history, consisting of reproductive phases each with a similar morphology. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

isomorphic alternation of generations.definition: a life history in which the haploid gametophytic thallus is structurally identical to the diploid sporophytic thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

isotype.definition: any duplicate (part of a single gathering made by a collector at one time) of the holotype. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

its.definition: non-coding regions associated with the nuclear-encoded ribosomal rna genes. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

karyogamy.definition: fusion of nuclei or nuclear material during sexual reproduction. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

karyological.definition: an adjective referring to nuclear cytological characteristics of a cell, especially with regard to the chromosomes. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

kelp.definition: a common name for large brown algae (laminariales), which have a holdfast, stipe, and blade. laciniate. cut deeply into lobes or segments; also having a tattered or fringed appearance. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

l.s..definition: longitudinal section. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

lacerate.definition: torn or irregularly cleft. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

laciniate.definition: cut into ribbons. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

lacunae.definition: cavities within a structure. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

lacunose.definition: with many holes (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

lamella.definition: leaf-like thallus lobe (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

lamellate.definition: composed of thin layers or plates; also used to refer to successive layers of mucilage or the structure of certain chloroplasts (see stratified). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

lamina.definition: flat expanded part of thallus. (source: Hiscock Brown).
a thin, plate-like thallus or a flat, thin part of a blade. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

laminarin.definition: a beta-glucan polysaccharide storage in chromistic algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

laminate.definition: of chloroplasts, flattened or plate-like. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

lanceolate.definition: long and pointed. lance-shaped. (source: Hiscock Brown).

lance or spear-shaped; much longer than broad and tapering from base to apex. lateral. a branch or frond on the side of an axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

lateral.definition: borne from the side of an axis (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

lateral cell.definition: cell in which the haploid nucleus is disposed of during post-fertilization development (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

lateral conceptacle.definition: conceptacle originating at the surface of an intergeniculum; in corallinoideae but not found in british isles species (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

lax.definition: loose and soft; not rigid. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

lectotype.definition: a specimen or published illustration from an author's original collection selected by a subsequent author to serve as the nomenclatural type in the absence of a holotype (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

legitimate.definition: a valid taxonomic name published in accordance with the rules of botanical nomenclature. lenticular thickening. an opaque, transverse, or longitudinal thickening in the internal walls of medullary cells in chondria (rhodomelaceae). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

lenticular.definition: lens-shaped (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

lenticular monosporangium.definition: a monosporangium formed by an oblique division of a cell by a curved wall. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

lenticular monospore.definition: spore released from a lenticular monosporangium. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

leptocaulous.definition: with the secondary segments of branches not increasing in size (sphacelariaceae). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

leucoplast.definition: a colorless plastid for biosynthetic and storage functions. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

life cycle.definition: the morphological and nuclear phases of an organism. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

life history.definition: the sum of an organism's morphological, cytological and reproductive phases. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

ligulate.definition: strap-like and short; also tongue-shaped. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

limicolous.definition: seaweeds that lack holdfasts and have bases embedded in mud. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

lineage.definition: a line or row of cells, usually indicating their origin. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

linear.definition: narrow, with parallel sides and several times longer than broad. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

linnaean system of nomenclature.definition: the system of nomenclature of binary names used for genera and species; names published after 1 may 1775. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

lithophyte.definition: a plant growing on rock or stones. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
growing on the surface of a rock or stone. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

littoral.definition: applied to that portion of the shore which is alternately exposed to the air and wetted either by the tide or by splash or spray. see section 6.1, introduction. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

lobate.definition: divided into lobes. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

lobe.definition: a forward projecting extension of an intergeniculum; in corallinoideae (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

loculus.definition: a chamber of a reproductive organ, containing usually a single gamete or spore. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

locum.definition: the individual compartments of a plurilocular sporangium. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

loose-lying.definition: not attached to but lying on the substrate or in shallow water. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

lubricous.definition: slippery. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

lumen.definition: the central cavity of a cell or a hollow thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

macroalga.definition: a large alga that is visible without a microscope. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

macroalgae.definition: larger algae readily observed without a microscope. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

macrogamete.definition: the larger (usually regarded as female) of anisogametes. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

macroscopic.definition: structures seen clearly with the unaided eye. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

macrothallus.definition: the larger, conspicuous, phase in the life history of an organism, as contrasted with the microthallus. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

macrozooid.definition: the larger of two differently sized zooids. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

macrozoosporangium.definition: a sporangium with relatively large locules, producing the larger of two differently-sized spores. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

maerl.definition: unattached, branched corallines, living or dead; often occurring in extensive deposits (maerl beds or banks) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).
the remains of calcareous red seaweeds (coralline rhodophytes); also a collective name for coralline red algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mammillate.definition: small protuberances or nipple-shaped lumps. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mangroves.definition: arborescent angiosperms characteristic of essentially marine, intertidal, mud-flat situations, in some genera with aerial pneumatophores arising from the roots. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

mannan.definition: any of a group of polysaccharides composed of (predominantly) mannose residues linked together. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

mannitol.definition: a sugar alcohol product of photosynthesis in brown algae that functions as a balance to salinity and serves as a storage product. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

margin.definition: peripheral area of a dorsiventral, nongeniculate thallus, often composed of basal and epithallial cells only and not usually bearing conceptacles (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

marginal conceptacle.definition: conceptacle originating at the margin of a flattened intergeniculum; in the corallinoideae (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

mariculture.definition: a specialized branch of aquaculture involving the cultivation of marine organisms for food and other products in the open ocean. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mastigoneme.definition: fine, microscopic hair-like structure on a flagellum (see also pantonematic). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mastigonemes.definition: fine, hair-like, appendages on flagella. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

matrix.definition: clear material in which the cells are set. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
clear material in which cells are set. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

matt.definition: thallus surface smooth and dull, not shiny; cf. glossy, grainy (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

medulla.definition: collective term for filaments derived from terminal initials, occurring internally to the cortex and running more or less parallel to the thallus surface (fig.2c); in a monomerous thallus (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

the often colorless central core of tissue in multicellular algae that is filamentous, pseudoparenchymatous, or parenchymatous. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

megacell.definition: an enlarged internal hyaline cell in crustose coralline algae (i.e., heterocyst, trichocyst). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

meiosis.definition: a type of nuclear division which results in daughter nuclei each containing half the number of chromosomes of the parent, i.e. chromosome number is reduced from diploid to haploid, and comprises two distinct nuclear divisions, which may be separated by cell division, the actual reduction in chromosome number taking place during the first division. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

meiosporangium.definition: a sporangium that produces spores by meiosis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

meiospore.definition: a spore produced by meiosis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

membranaceous.definition: like a membrane. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

membranous.definition: delicate thin sheet of cells resembling a membrane. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).
a sheet or a thin layer that is often semitransparent. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

meriblastic.definition: branching by outgrowth of small peripheral cells on the axes (in cladostephus). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

meristem.definition: a group of cells which divide and cause growth. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

meristematic.definition: tissue of active cell division and growth. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

meristoderm.definition: a row of superficial (epidermal) cells that provide for increased girth by active division (laminariales). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mesochiton collar.definition: the thickened, collar-like, inwardly projecting ring of central wall material, near the apices of oogonia in the seirococcaceae. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

microfibrils.definition: very small fibrils or threads visible at high magnification. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

microscopic.definition: not visible to the unaided eye. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

microthallus.definition: the small, filamentous, inconspicuous phase of an organism, alternating with a larger phase (the macrothallus). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

midlittoral.definition: applied to the middle portion of the littoral q.v. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

midrib.definition: a thickened, central, longitudinal rib (costa, vein) of a blade. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

midvein.definition: a usually delicate median line of cells, with the blade being thicker through this region than on either side. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mitosis.definition: the typical process of nuclear division in eukaryotic cells, in which one set of duplicated chromosomes segregates into a daughter nucleus, resulting in daughter nuclei each containing a set of chromosomes, identical to that of the parent nucleus, and which is followed by cell division. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

mitospore.definition: a spore formed as a direct result of mitosis. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

mitotype.definition: a molecular term for a single fixed genetic difference. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mixed phases.definition: thallus bearing reproductive structures normally found only on separate individuals, e.g. both gametangia and tetrasporangia. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

mlwnt.definition: mean low water level of neap tides. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

mollusc.definition: a phylum of invertebrates that includes snails, slugs, mussels, and octopuses. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

moniliform.definition: bead-like; a filament with regular constrictions. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

monocarpogonial.definition: a single carpogonial filament is associated with a support cell. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

monoecious.definition: with male and female gametangia on the same thallus. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

monomerous.definition: thallus type composed of medulla and cortex (fig. 2c); cf dimerous (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

monomorphic.definition: occurring in one morphological form. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

monophasic.definition: with a single ploidy level (e.g. haploid or diploid). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

monophyletic.definition: derived from a common ancestor plus all and only all of its descendants. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

monopodial.definition: growth by means of a continuous apical growing point. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

a type of growth in which secondary axes arise behind and are subsidiary to a main axis that grows indefinitely. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

monosiphonous.definition: a single row of cells; also, a uniseriate structure or tube. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

monospecific.definition: referring to a genus containing a single species. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

monosporangium.definition: a structure in which a monospore arises {see also lenticular monosporangium above). (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

monospore.definition: a spore formed in a monosporangium (see also lenticular monospore above). (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

monostromatic.definition: composed of a single layer of cells. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

monotypic.definition: a family or genus with only one taxonomic component; axes or populations that are phenotypically consistent. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

morphology.definition: the form of the thallus or structure. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

mucilage.definition: general term for complex substances composed of various types of polysaccharides, becoming viscous and slimy when wet. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
soft and often a slimy colloidal material. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mucilaginous.definition: containing or composed of mucilage. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

mucro.definition: a short, sharp, point. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

mucron.definition: short, sharp point. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

mucronate.definition: furnished with a mucro. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

multiaxial.definition: a type of thallus construction in which each axis includes a core of principal, co-dominant filaments; cf. uniaxial (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

multiaxial growth or organization.definition: thalli with a core of parallel filaments, with each filament being derived from an apical cell. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

multicellular.definition: composed of more than one cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

multifarious.definition: branching in irregular directions (e.g., radial branching). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

multifid.definition: having many divisions. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

multinucleate.definition: containing more than two nuclei (e.g. fig. 41c). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

multiseriate.definition: a filament with cells divided periclinally to form two or more rows. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

multistichous.definition: an axis having branches on all sides. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

multistratose.definition: having multiple layers of cells. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

muricate.definition: rough surfaced, with short, hard, points. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

mutic.definition: without a terminal point. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

myrionemoid.definition: said of a thallus which resembles myrionema (discoid, monostromatic). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

nemathecium.definition: a raised surface of a thallus containing reproductive organs. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

neotenic.definition: with features of early stages of development persisting in adult; plants sometimes reproducing in apparently juvenile state; see fosliella-state of hydrolithon (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

neotype.definition: a specimen or illustration selected to serve as nomenclatural type as long as all of the original material on which the name of the taxon was based is missing. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

neutral conchospore.definition: differentiated filaments which differ from the surrounding vegetative conchocelis. each sporangium produces a single product which germinates, sometimes in situ, to form further conchocelis. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

neutral sporangia.definition: sporangia producing mitospores which re-cycle the same phase of the life history. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

neutral spore.definition: a spore formed by the mitotic cleavage of blade cells, without fertilization, and germinating into blades. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

node.definition: joint in a segmented axis; end-walls between contiguous cells of a filament (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).
the site on an axis where blades or branches arise. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

nodulose.definition: knotty, with local swellings, or minutely knobby in appearance. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

nom. cons..definition: nomen conservandum, or a name conserved according to the international code of botanical nomenclature. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

nomen dubium.definition: a doubtful name, to be discarded according to the international code of botanical nomenclature. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

nomenclatural type.definition: that element to which the name of a taxon is permanently attached, whether as a correct name or as a synonym (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

nomenclature.definition: the taxonomic system of naming or the use of rules to correctly determine the scientific name of an organism. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

nucule.definition: in charophyceae, a female reproductive structure including an oogonium and outer protective cells. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

nutritive cell.definition: a specialized cell in advanced red algae that receives a diploid nucleus from a fertilized carpogonium, or its division product, and provides nourishment for the carposporophyte generation. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

nutritive filament.definition: see connecting filament. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

nutritive tissue.definition: in advanced red algae, a sterile tissue associated with the gonimoblast or a mixture of vegetative and non-sporangial cells that presumably furnish the developing carposporophyte with extra nutrients. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ob.definition: inverted, e.g. obconical. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

oblanceolate.definition: lance-shaped, but with the narrower end basal or attached. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

oblate.definition: flattened or depressed at the poles or on opposite sides. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

obligate.definition: binding, obligatory; limited to one mode of life or action. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

oblong-elliptical.definition: a shape that is intermediate between oblong and ellipse when viewed in 2 dimensions (i.e., a 2-dimensional term). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

obovate.definition: broadest part above the middle. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

obovoid.definition: egg-shaped, but broadest near the upper end (a three-dimensional term). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

obtuse.definition: blunt or rounded at the end. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

ocellate.definition: shaped like an eye, having eye-like spots, or possessing circular patches or spots. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

octosporangium.definition: sporangium that contains eight spores at maturity, usually derived from a binucleate cell. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

ooblast.definition: in advanced red algae, a filament that transfers a zygote nucleus (directly or indirectly) from the fertilized carpogonium to an auxiliary cell (see connecting filament). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

oogamy.definition: the fusion of two dissimilar gametes, usually a large non-motile egg and a small motile antherozoid (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
sexual reproduction in which a small, usually motile sperm fuses with a larger non-motile egg. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

oogonium.definition: the female reproductive organ(s), each containing one or more eggs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

oospore.definition: a thick-walled zygote with food reserves; also a fertilized gamete. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

opaque.definition: not allowing the passage of light; not transparent. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

operculum.definition: a lid opening by a slit and lifting away. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

opposite branching.definition: a type of branching in which 2 branches occur at a node, with these being opposite or about 180° to each other. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

orbicular.definition: more or less circular (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

orbital ridges.definition: raised concentric rings round margin of thick thallus (e.g. phymatolithon lenormandii) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

orbital rings.definition: concentric markings round edge of bistratose thallus (e.g. fosliella-state of hydrolithon) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

order.definition: a taxonomic group between class and family, with the name ending in -ales. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).
a category of taxa between class and family. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

organelle.definition: a specialized structure within a cell e.g. plastid, nucleus. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

osmiophilic.definition: staining readily with osmium stains. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

ostiole.definition: a small pore-like opening, usually of a conceptacle. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
a small pore for the escape of reproductive cells. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ovate.definition: egg-shaped with broader end at base. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

ovoid.definition: egg-shaped, broadest near the base (a three-dimensional term). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).
in outline, the broadest part is above the middle. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

palisade cell.definition: cell of a basal filament which is relatively tall, narrow and obliquely orientated in vs; adjacent palisade cells have end walls at the same level (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

palmate.definition: flat and lobed; divided like the palm of a hand (see digitate). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

palmelloid.definition: a group of single nonmotile cells in a gelatinous mass. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

panicle.definition: a loose cluster of reproductive organs; a branched raceme. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

pantonematic.definition: flagella that bear microscopic hairs (mastigonemes). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

papilla.definition: minute short, nipple-like growths. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

papillae.definition: small swollen cells sometimes lining the pore canal (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

paranemata.definition: sterile hairs (e.g., paraphyses). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

paraphyletic.definition: a group that includes a most recent common ancestor plus only some of its descendants. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

paraphyses.definition: sterile filaments, usually uniseriate, on the thallus surface or within conceptacles. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

paraphysis.definition: a sterile filament, or cell usually associated with the reproductive organs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

parasporangium.definition: a sporangium that forms more than 4 spores, with at least the first division being mitotic; thus, it is not a tetrasporangium. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

paraspore.definition: spore released by a parasporangium. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

paraspores.definition: spores in 3n fronds of the ceramiaceae that grow into the next generation; not homologous to tetrasporangia. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

paratype.definition: a specimen or illustration cited in the protologue that is neither the holotype nor an isotype, nor one of the syntypes if two or more specimens were simultaneously designated as types. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

parenchyma.definition: compact tissue formed by cell division in all planes. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
a compact tissue of thin-walled isodiametric cells. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

parenchymatous.definition: a tissue of thin-walled, more or less isodiametric cells, derived by division in different planes. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

parent cell.definition: the initial source or origin of subsequent cells (structures). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

parietal.definition: lying along the wall, peripheral to the cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

parthenogenesis.definition: development of gametes without fertilization. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

parthenogenetic.definition: developing without fertilization. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

patent.definition: spreading. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pectinate.definition: with branches restricted to one side of the axis (teeth of a comb). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pedicel.definition: a stalk of a reproductive organ. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
a stalk of a reproductive organ. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pedicellate.definition: borne on a pedicel. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

pelagic.definition: free-floating or not attached. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

peltate.definition: a circular blade attached by a central stalk on the ventral surface. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

peltoid.definition: prostrate and more or less disc-like; contrasting with trichoid. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

penicillate.definition: brush-like or pencil-shaped. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

percurrent.definition: extending throughout the entire length of a structure; usually said of a persistent axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

perennate.definition: thalli (or portion) that can live through a number of years, usually with an annual quiescent period, or survive for an indefinite number of years. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

perennial.definition: lasting more than two years. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

perfoliate.definition: a stem-like portion that extends through the center of a blade. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

perforate.definition: full of holes, having many pores. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

periaxial cell.definition: one of a number, often a ring, of cells cut off from and surrounding an axial cell (e.g. fig. 97e). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

pericarp.definition: the haploid gametophytic tissue of a cystocarp that surrounds the diploid gonimoblast in some red algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

periclinal.definition: parallel to the surface. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

pericyst.definition: a peripheral cell differing in size, colour and contents, and functioning as a dormant initial (sphacelariales). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

pericysts.definition: darkly pigmented cells in members of the spacelariaceae; their presence is a useful taxonomic feature. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

peridinal.definition: being parallel to a designated surface (see anticlinal). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

periphery.definition: on the circumference of the cell or structure. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

perithallial filaments.definition: name sometimes used for erect filaments or cortex (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

perithallus.definition: the central tissue of a crustose alga that is produced inwardly by an intercalary meristem. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

petiolate.definition: stalked leaves, vesicles or other macroscopic organs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

phaeophyceae.definition: class of brown algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

phaeophycean hair.definition: a filament (without phaeoplasts) of uniseriate cells developing from a basal meristem of few to several dividing cells. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

phaeophycean hairs.definition: colorless, endogenous, uniseriate filaments in some brown algae with a distinct basal meristem and a basal collar or sheath (see true hairs). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

phaeoplast.definition: the photosynthetic plastid of brown algae, distinguished by its brown colour, presence of fucoxanthin and other pigments, and thylakoids in groups of three. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

phenotype.definition: morphology resulting from combined effects of genotype and environment. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

phragmoplast.definition: an assemblage of microtubules parallel to the spindle axis at telophase of mitosis, across which the cell plate develops. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

phycobilins.definition: protein-bound, water-soluble pigments in members of the cryptophyta, cyanobacteria, and rhodophyta; the pigments reflect red and blue light. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

phycobiliproteins.definition: red (phycoerythrin) and blue (phycocyanin) pigments present with chlorophylls in red algae and cyanobacteria that assist in photosynthesis by transferring light energy that they absorb to chlorophyll. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

phycobilisome.definition: a small particle present on photosynthetic lamellae of red algae and cyanobacteria which comprise phycobiliproteins. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

phycocolloid.definition: colloidal or mucilaginous substances in cell walls of seaweeds (e.g., agar, carrageenan, laminaran), which are extracted for their stabilizing, thickening, and gelling properties. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

phycocyanin.definition: a blue light reflecting phycobilin pigment. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

phycoerythrin.definition: see entry for phycobiliproteins. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

phyllospore.definition: spore produced by the blade phase where the ploidy level and development are unknown. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

phyllospores.definition: in the bangiales, spores produced by the blade phase where the ploidy level and development are unknown. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

phylum.definition: a major group of plants, equivalent to division. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).
division). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

physodes.definition: vesicle-like globules in cells of most brown algae, containing phenolic compounds. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

piliferous.definition: bearing hairs or setae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pinna.definition: ultimate branches or branchlets in pinnately branched axes. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pinnate.definition: (see fig. 23) flattened in one plane, with pinnae or side branches. receptacle often swollen part of the thallus bearing reproductive structures called conceptacles (particularly in the fucaceae). 'fruiting bodies'. (source: Hiscock Brown).
with branches arranged in 2 rows on opposite sides of an axis; also in pairs or alternating like a feather. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pinnatifid.definition: deeply incised in a semi-pinnate manner. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pit connection.definition: small pore between adjacent cells, occluded by a plug. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

pit-connection.definition: a cytoplasmic strand connecting two adjacent cells through a pit in their wall. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

placenta.definition: in the red algae, a large cell usually consisting of fused fertile tissue and bearing gonimoblastic filaments of carposporangia; a part of a cystocarp to which carpospores are attached. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

planozygote.definition: a motile (flagellated) zygote. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

plasticity.definition: the capacity of an organism to change its form in response to varying environmental conditions. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

plastid.definition: cell organelle enclosed by a double membrane which in red algae contain thylakoids and photosynthetic pigments. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

pleiomorphy.definition: the ability of organisms to exhibit two or more different forms in their life history. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

pleomorphic.definition: having many forms or with 2 or more distinct states in an alga's life history. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

plethysmothallus.definition: a haploid or diploid microthallic phase capable of asexual multiplication by zoospores. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

a diploid filamentous stage of some brown algae that can recycle itself by means of zoospores or initiate an upright foliose blade. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

plexus.definition: a branching network of filaments. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

plicate.definition: folded, usually lengthwise. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

plug.definition: mucilaginous substance blocking (usually multiporate) conceptacle pore (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).
