plumose.definition: feathery or appearing feather- or plume-like. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

plurilocular.definition: containing many loculi or cells, said of reproductive organs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

plurilocular sporangium.definition: in brown algae, a sporangium or gametangium with many small locules; these are the site of mitosis and can either produce zoospores (1n or 2n) or gametes (1n). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pluriseriate.definition: a thallus that is more than 2 cells in thickness (synonym multiseriate). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

plurispore.definition: a spore produced from a plurilocular sporangium. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

plurispores.definition: spores (usually zoospores) produced from plurilocular sporangia in brown algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pluristromatic.definition: formed of several to many layers of cells or stroma. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

pneumatocyst.definition: a large air bladder or float (see vesicle). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

poleward.definition: toward the pole of the earth; facing toward the pole. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

polychotomous.definition: division at one point into several sub-equal branches. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

branching many times from a terminal point or area; a condition in which an axis branches in many lobes of equal status. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

polyhedral.definition: with many faces like a crystal. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

polymorphic.definition: occurring in many morphological forms. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

polyphyletic.definition: a taxonomic group having origin in several different lines of descent. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

polyploid.definition: a nucleus with more than the normal sets of chromosomes (e.g., 2n or 4n). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

polysaccharide.definition: a polymer with sugar molecules as the repeating units. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

polysiphonia-type life history.definition: with two independent, isomorphic, life-history phases, the haploid gametophyte and the diploid tetrasporophyte, and a further diploid phase, the carposporophyte, that grows on the female plant and is usually surrounded by protective tissue formed by the female. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

polysiphonous.definition: in some red algae, an axial cell that is surrounded by a ring of pericentral cells of the same length. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

polysporangium.definition: sporangium containing more than 8 spores, usually developing from a multinucleate cell. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).
forming polyspores, generally more than 4. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

polystichous.definition: arranged in many ranks. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

polystromatic.definition: a blade-like morphology with 2 or more layers (cf. distromatic, monostromatic). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

porate.definition: porous or filled with openings. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pore.definition: hole(s) in a conceptacle roof through which sporangia escape (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

pore canal.definition: passage between a pore and a conceptacle chamber, applicable when the conceptacle roof is thick (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

pore plate.definition: the roof of a multiporate conceptacle that contains pore plugs in some red algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pore-plate.definition: roof of multiporate conceptacle that contains the pore plugs (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

posteriolateral.definition: in a lateral and posterior position. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

posterior.definition: the rear position; opposite of anterior. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

ppt.definition: abbreviation for "parts per thousand"; used to designate salinity values. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pre-linnaean system.definition: names or works that were published before 1 may 1775 (cf. linnaean). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

primary branches.definition: the main, usually long, branches arising from the top of the stipe. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

primary branching.definition: branching which originates in or near apical meristems; in geniculate corallines; cf. secondary branching (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

primary gonimoblast cell.definition: first-formed cell of gonimoblast. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

primary pit connection.definition: connection formed between two successive cells of a filament during cell division; cf. secondary pit connection (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

primary pit connections.definition: a pit formed between 2 successive cells in a filament during cell division (cf. secondary pit connection). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

primordium.definition: group of initials, especially those initiating a conceptacle (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).
an early aggregation of cells that differentiates into a recognizable structure. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

priority.definition: a taxonomic term for the acceptance of one of 2 competing names that are otherwise equally acceptable. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pro parte.definition: a latin phrase that indicates the understanding of one author represents only part of what the original author described. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

procarp.definition: carpogonial branch and auxiliary cell in close proximity in branching system. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

a term describing a close association between a carpogonium and an auxiliary cell within a single branch system of some advanced red algae (florideophyceae). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

procaryotic.definition: organisms whose cells lack distinct membrane-bounded nuclei and chloroplasts in contrast to eukaryotic cells. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

procumbent.definition: lying flat on a substratum. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

proliferation.definition: vegetative outgrowth of a new thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

proliferous.definition: production of outgrowths similar to and usually smaller than the main axis (e.g., adventitious branches or branchlets and offshoots). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

prominent.definition: protruding markedly and abruptly from the thallus surface; used of conceptacles; cf. raised (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

propagule.definition: structure that becomes detached from parent plant and gives rise to a new individual. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

prostrate.definition: lying flat on the substrate. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

prostrate system.definition: trailing on the substratum; lying closely along a surface. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

protandrous.definition: sexual reproduction with the antheridia maturing before the oogonia. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

protologue.definition: all the information associated with the original publication of a taxonomic name (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

protonema.definition: in brown algae, a microscopic filamentous system that does not recycle itself by plurilocular sporangia (i.e., zoospores) but instead produces the macroscopic sporophyte directly (see plethysmothallus) (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

protoplasm.definition: the living contents of a cell, consisting of cytoplasm and nucleus. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

protoplasts.definition: plant cell with cell wall removed; the living component of the cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

prototrichogyne.definition: rudimentary trichogyne (see womersley 1994, griffin et al. 1999) . (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

protrandous.definition: having male gametes produced before female gametes on the same thallus. such algae may appear dioecious but are really monoecious. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

protuberance.definition: knob-like outgrowth from crustose thallus (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

protuberant.definition: bulging outward. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

proximal.definition: toward the base of a thallus (versus distal). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

psammophyte.definition: a seaweed that grows on/in unconsolidated sediment or grows on rocky substrata impacted by sand scouring. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pseudoconchocelis.definition: resembling conchocelis but without pit connections or fertile cell rows. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

pseudodichotomous.definition: of branching, displacement of a lateral branch towards the axis, thus giving the appearance of a dichotomy. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

forming 2 unequal dichotomies or having 2 equal branches at branch point, with one being derived from a lateral branch. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pseudodichotomous branching.definition: appearing dichotomous but resulting from two successive cell divisions (fig.1) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

pseudodisc.definition: having the appearance of a disc but comprising irregularly adjoined and associated filaments. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

pseudofilament.definition: an incidental linear arrangement of cells that forms a somewhat filamentous thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pseudohairs.definition: in brown algae, hairs that possess plastids, terminate filament tips only, and lack a distinct basal meristem and sheath. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pseudolateral.definition: branched pigmented monosiphonous filaments in the dasyaceae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pseudolateral conceptacle.definition: conceptacle originating in apex of aborted secondary branch and protruding more than lateral conceptacles; in corallina (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

pseudoparenchyma.definition: aggregated filaments having the appearance of a parenchyma but analogous not homologous (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

pseudoparenchymatous.definition: parenchyma-like due to lateral adherence or interweaving of filaments, but without cell divisions in all planes. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

pseudoperennial.definition: a perennial taxon that exists in a reduced or altered state during unfavorable periods for growth. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pseudostreblonematoid.definition: with a form similar to, but probably of separate origin from, strehlonerna, i.e. with prostrate endophytic filaments bearing erect filaments emerging from the host. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

pulvinate.definition: cushion-like (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

punctate.definition: characterized by a dot-like appearance. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

pyramidal.definition: shaped like a pyramid or with a pointed tip and a 4-sided base. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

pyrenoid.definition: an organelle occurring within or adjacent to a chloroplast; often associated with reserve food accumulation. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

pyriform.definition: pear-shaped or being broader at the base (distally) than at the top (proximally). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

quadrangular.definition: four cornered, usually with right angles. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

quadrate.definition: square. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
having 4 sides and 4 angles. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

quadrichotomous.definition: forming four branches at each branch point. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

quadriflagellate.definition: having 4 flagella, as with a green algal zoospore. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

quadrinucleate.definition: containing four nuclei. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

raceme.definition: a long indeterminate group of cells that may be reproductive. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

racemose.definition: in red algae, the arrangement of stalked cystocarps on a branchlet. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rachis.definition: portion of a seaweed axis that bears subordinate parts oflimited growth in 2 opposite ranks. radial branching. when laterals arise from all sides of an axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

radial.definition: on the radii of the structure or around an axis. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

raised.definition: (used of conceptacles) protruding gradually somewhat above the thallus surface; cf. prominent (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

ralfsioid.definition: said of a thallus which resembles ralfsia (pseudoparenchymatous and crustose.) (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

ramellus.definition: a secondary branch (branchlet). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ramulus.definition: lesser or ultimate branchlets. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

rbcl.definition: the large-chain ribulose 1, 5 bisphosphate carboxylase gene sequence that is part of the chloroplast dna molecule. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rbcl-rbcs.definition: intergenic spacer within the plastid genome; see rubisco. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

receptacle.definition: a fertile area where gametangia or sporangia occur in some brown (e.g., fucales) and red algae (e.g., corallinales). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

reflexed.definition: bent abruptly backwards at more than 90°. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

refractile.definition: refracting light. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

reniform.definition: kidney-shaped. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

repent.definition: bent over, prostrate, or creeping along a substratum. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

residue.definition: the remains, usually short and stubby, on an axis or branch when a lateral has been lost (e.g. in cystophora). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

reticulate.definition: appearing as a network. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

retroflex.definition: bent sharply backwards or downwards from the axis. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

retuse.definition: a shallow notch usually located at an obtuse apex. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

revolute.definition: rolled back from the margin or apex. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rhachis.definition: the main axis of a compound branch system. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

rhizines.definition: thick-walled rhizoidal filaments in the medulla of some red algae (e.g., gelidium). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rhizoid.definition: a downward growing hyphal-like uniseriate filament that functions in attachment or thickens the axis (e.g., rhizoidal filament). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rhizoidal filament.definition: filament resembling a rhizoid but not necessarily involved in attachment, sometimes formed internally within thallus. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

rhizomatous.definition: having rhizomes, runners, or stolons (see stolon). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rhizome.definition: a prostrate stem-like portion. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rhodolith.definition: a term sometimes used for coralline nodules with a nonalgal core; cf. maerl (see introduction 4.1) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

rhodoliths.definition: spherical growths of free-living non-geniculate coralline red algae that form around pebbles or shell fragments. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rib.definition: a thickened ridge-like reinforcement in a flattened thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ribosome.definition: cytoplasmic particle carrying out protein synthesis; made up of rna and protein; free in cytoplasm or attached to endoplasmic reticulum (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

rigid.definition: stiff, inflexible. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

robust.definition: strongly developed, often thick, compared to related taxa. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

roof.definition: the outer surface of a deeply embedded conceptacle in red algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rosette.definition: an imitation of a rose. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

rostellate.definition: somewhat beaked; narrowed to a slender tip. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

rostrate.definition: ending in a long, often beak-like, point. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

row.definition: laterally aligned contiguous cells of erect or cortical filaments (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

rubisco.definition: ribulose 1,5-bisphosphate carboxylase oxygenase; the enzyme which catalyzes the reaction that fixes co2 into carbohydrates and is located in the stromal space of the plastid; encoded by the rbcl and rbcs genes. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

ruffle.definition: frill, pleat. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
with a strong wavy margin. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

rugose.definition: roughened or wrinkled. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

runner.definition: stolon, rhizome, or horizontal prostrate structure. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

saccate.definition: inflated, sac-like, or appearing like a sack. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

saxicolous.definition: growing on rocks or stones (e.g., lithophytic). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

scalariform.definition: with laterals or their residues arranged like a ladder with cross rungs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

scar cell.definition: basal remnant of a trichoblast that appears as a small cell. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

scutate.definition: shield-shaped; a crustose, lobed to flattened thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

seagrass.definition: a marine monocotyledon growing submerged at least at high tide. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

secondary branching.definition: branching originating well below branch apices in intergenicular cortex; in geniculate corallines; cf. primary branching (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

secondary pit connection.definition: pore formed between cells of different filaments, established by formation of a connector (= conjunctor) cell that fuses with one of the cells. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

pit connection formed secondarily and directly between two mature cells of contiguous thallus filaments; cf. primary pit connection (other red algae form secondary pit connections indirectly) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

secondary pit connections.definition: a pit formed between 2 mature cells of contiguous filaments (cf. primary pit connections). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

secund.definition: arranged on one side only (e.g. branchlets, fig. 2b). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

secund branching.definition: arranged in a row along one side of an axis (source: Algaebase (2021-05)).

sedis incertae.definition: a latin phrase meaning "uncertain seat"; also a category of uncertain taxonomic position. segment. a joint or one of the portions into which a thallus is divided. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

segment.definition: a division of an axis or branch; a large cell of a series. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

segregative cell division.definition: cell division where the protoplast divides into 2 or more spherical multinucleate bodies within the mother cell. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

seirosporangia.definition: monosporangia produced terminally in a linear series. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

semi-endophytic.definition: growing partly within a plant, e.g. choreonema (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

sensu.definition: latin term “in the sense of” or “as described by” (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

septate.definition: transverse cell walls that form distinct cellular compartments. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

septation.definition: the occurrence of cross walls or septa. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

septum.definition: division. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

a partition of primary wall material, usually formed during cell division to separate newly formed daughter cells. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

seriate.definition: cells or spores arranged in a series. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

serrate.definition: with a saw-like edge to the thallus. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
marginal teeth pointed toward the apex; saw-toothed. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sessile.definition: without a stalk. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

seta.definition: stiff hair, projection or bristle. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
hyaline hair-like outgrowths of a cell that lacks nuclei. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

setaceous.definition: bristle-like; covered with spines. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sheath.definition: a tubular enveloping structure. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

siderophilic.definition: having an affinity for fatty substances (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

sieve-tube.definition: conducting elements in the phloem of vascular plants; similar elements occur in the stipes of laminariales. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

silicle.definition: a short bean-like structure (silique) that is not much longer than wide. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

simple.definition: unbranched (e.g. of spermatangial systems) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

sinuate.definition: with a wavy outline, used of basal cells and rows of erect filament cells (mainly in titanoderma) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

sinuous.definition: with a wavy outline or margin to the thallus. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

sinusoidal.definition: curved backwards and forwards like a sine wave (e.g. fig. 5c). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

siphon.definition: a tubular structure that lacks cross walls, as in the coenocytic green alga codium. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

siphonaceous.definition: having a tubular, non-septate multinucleate thallus, such as in the green algae bryopsis and codium. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

siphonous.definition: multinucleate and tubular, with few or no transverse septa (e.g., coenocyte). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

smooth thallus.definition: thallus surface lacking microscopic protrusions, flakes etc. and therefore not roughened; cf. flat thallus which applies to macroscopic features (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

solenocysts.definition: elongated, multinucleated, longitudinal conducting elements in some kelps and members of the phyllariaceae ( see allelocysts). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sorus.definition: an aggregation of sporangia/reproductive organs. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

spatulate.definition: ovate with an attenuated base. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

specialised rhizoidal cells.definition: lowermost cells of thallus with large heads and elongated extensions lying within the thallus wall (fig. 32). (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

species.definition: a taxonomic term referring to the lowest principal nomenclatural rank. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sperm.definition: a flagellated male gamete. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

spermatangial branch.definition: aggregation of spermatangial mother cells into a compact structure bearing numerous spermatangia (e.g. fig. 49d). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

spermatangial mother cell.definition: cell that bears spermatangia. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

spermatangium.definition: a male cell forming a single spermatium. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

spermatium.definition: non-pigmented, non-flagellated male gamete. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).
in red algae, a nonmotile or amoeboid colorless male gamete. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

spike.definition: an elongate structure with an axis bearing sessile reproductive organs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

spindle-shaped.definition: a cylindrical axis that tapers to both ends (e.g., fusiform). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

spine.definition: a stiff, sharp-pointed projection on a cell or tissue. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

spinous.definition: bearing spines. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

spinulose.definition: spiny, covered with small spines. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sporangia.definition: spore producing cells or structures. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

sporangium.definition: cell that releases one or more spores. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

spore.definition: a single-celled asexual reproductive body that is either motile or nonmotile. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sporophyll.definition: a blade-bearing sporangia. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sporophyte.definition: the diploid phase in a life history that produces spores. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

spout.definition: tube-like extension of spermatangial (rarely tetrasporangial) pore (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

spur.definition: a short, horn-like projection. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

squamulose.definition: with small, slightly overlapping thallus lobes (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

squarish.definition: more or less isodiametric (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

statospore.definition: a single-celled asexual structure in which the entire spore is formed inside the vegetative cell (e.g., tribonema). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

stellate.definition: star-shaped, radiating. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

stephanokont.definition: having a ring or crown of flagella. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sterile cells.definition: cells (filament) produced during the formation of procarps in some red algae (e.g. paraphyses). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sterile group.definition: cells formed during post-fertilization development that do not contribute to gonimoblast development. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

stichidium.definition: specialized pod-like branchlet bearing series of tetrasporangia (e.g. fig. 85d). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).
in red algae, specialized branchlets of distinctive shape that bear spermatangia or tetrasporangia. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

stipe.definition: the lowermost stalk-like part of an erect frond. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
the lower-most stem-like region of a thallus. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

stipitate.definition: stalked. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

stipulode.definition: a needle-shaped structure at the base of secondary laterals in the characeae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

stolon.definition: a prostrate or creeping axis, lying on the substrate, from which erect branches arise. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

a branch or runner growing out from the base of a parent frond, which is capable of producing offshoots/uprights (see also runner). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

stoloniferous.definition: stolon-like or stolon-bearing. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

stomatocyst.definition: an ornamented siliceous cyst in the class chrysophyceae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

stratified.definition: having successive layers; often refers to mucilage (see lamellate). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

streblonematoid.definition: with the form of streblonerna, i.e. with prostrate endophytic filaments bearing erect filaments emerging from the host. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

streblonemoid.definition: said of a thallus which resembles that of streblonema (prostrate branched filaments). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

striae.definition: rays or rows of differentiated cells. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).
bands, furrows, ridges, or fine delicate lines. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

striate.definition: marked with bands, furrows or ridges. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

stromatocyst.definition: cysts found in the class chrysophyceae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

stubby.definition: short, thick and usually rounded. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

stupose.definition: covered with a felt of hairs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

sub-conical.definition: nearly or approximately conical. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sub-hemispherical.definition: nearly or approximately spherical. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sub-pinnately.definition: nearly or approximately pinnately branched. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

sub-spherical.definition: nearly or approximately spherical. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

subacute.definition: somewhat acute. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

subapical.definition: immediately below the apex or tip. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

subclass.definition: a taxonomic group between class and order. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

subcortex.definition: the inner part of the cortex, differing somewhat from the cortex (e.g. in chordariaceae). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

subdichotomous.definition: almost dichotomous but not truly so. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

subepithallial initial.definition: a subterminal initial on an erect or cortical filament, cutting off epithallial cells outwardly and erect filament or cortical cells inwardly (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

subfasciculate.definition: almost fasciculate. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

sublittoral fringe.definition: a distinctive fringe zone which is sometimes characteristic of the region just below the eulittoral. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

subquadrate.definition: almost square. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

subsidiary cell.definition: in some red algae, a vegetative cell born on a supporting cell that becomes part of a fusion cell. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

subspherical.definition: almost spherical. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

substrate.definition: the place (e.g. rock, sand, mud or a host) to which an organism is attached. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

substratum.definition: any surface upon which plant grows (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).
a surface on which an organism is attached. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

subtending.definition: standing below. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

subterete.definition: almost terete. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

subtidal.definition: below the lowest low-tide level and similar to the sublittoral zone; a physical term (see sublittoral). subulate. awl-shaped or slender and tapering to a point. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

supernumerary nuclei.definition: the nuclei (commonly 7) which are rejected from inclusion in the egg cell following meiosis in the oogonium (e.g. in cystoseiraceae). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

supporting cell.definition: a cell bearing one or more carpogonial branches and constituting a layer across the floor of a carpogonial conceptacle (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

sympatric.definition: with areas of distribution that coincide or overlap (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

sympodial.definition: growth where the apex of an axis is displaced by a subtending lateral branch and becomes a pseudo lateral. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

syn type.definition: a taxonomic term meaning a specimen cited by the author if no holotype was designated; one of a number of specimens given as types. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

syngamy.definition: the union of 2 gametes or fertilization. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

synonym.definition: one of two or more names for the same taxon. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

syntype.definition: any one of two or more specimens cited by the author when no holotype was designated; or any one of two or more specimens simultaneously designated as types. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

tabulae incertae.definition: a latin phrase meaning "an uncertain record (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tannin cell.definition: a cell with dark phenolic inclusions. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

taxon.definition: a group of organisms, at any level, in the classification of plants or animals. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

taxonomy.definition: the orderly recognition of organisms according to their presumed natural relationships. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tela arachnoidea.definition: a latin phrase describing a network oflong cells on the inside of pericarps and surrounding carposporophytes (e.g., rhodymeniales). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tendril.definition: a twining or clasping structure. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

terete.definition: circular in transverse section. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

terminal.definition: outer tip, distal end, apex, or the end cell in a chain. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

terminal initial.definition: an initial terminating a filament; cf. subepithallial initial (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

tetra/ bisporangial.definition: term used when data apply to both types of conceptacle (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

tetrahedral.definition: division of tetrasporangium in which all radial walls are at 120° to each other. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

tetrasporangium.definition: a sporangium whose contents divide meiotically (presumably) and (in corallinaceae) simultaneously to form four zonately arranged haploid (presumably) tetraspores; cf.bisporangium (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).
a single-celled sporangium in which 4 tetraspores are produced by meiosis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tetraspore.definition: one of the four spores formed in a tetrasporangium. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

tetrasporoblast.definition: a gonimoblast producing tetrasporangia instead of the more usual carposporangia. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tetrasporocyte.definition: contents of a sporangium destined to divide into four spores (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

tetrasporophyte.definition: a diploid phase (sporophyte) in a life history of a red alga that usually bears haploid tetraspores. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tetrastichous.definition: in four rows along axis. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

thallus.definition: a term used for the whole organism. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
a general term for algal morphologies that lack a true embryo phase and are non-vascular (see cryptogamic). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

theca.definition: a sac or case. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

thylakoid.definition: pigmented membranous vesicles within plastids; the site of photosynthesis. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

tier.definition: stratum of aligned vegetative cells (fig.12) (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

tomentose.definition: wooly or covered with dense matted hairs or filaments. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tongue cell.definition: a specialised initial cell formed during the development of a conceptacle. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

tortuous.definition: having repeated bends or twists; also winding or contorted. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

torulose.definition: cylindric, with swellings at intervals. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

trabeculum.definition: finger- or strand-like wall ingrowths (e.g., ulva radiata). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

transluscent.definition: letting light pass; semi-transparent. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

transverse.definition: section of material made at right angles to its long axis (e.g., a cross section). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tribe.definition: phylogenetic grouping of genera at a level below that of subfamily. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

tribuliform.definition: almost triangular in face view, but with a small bulge in the middle of the upper side. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

trichoblast.definition: a simple or branched filament that is pigmented or colorless; it arises exogenously from the tips of thalli and is usually shed (deciduous). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

trichoblasts.definition: simple or branched filaments, pigmented or colourless, formed in particular positions near apices, often on every segment of axis, usually shed rapidly (deciduous). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

trichocyst.definition: an enlarged internal hyaline cell in crustose coralline algae; also called a heterocyst or megacell. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

trichocyte.definition: a complex of one or more surface or near surface cells potentially hair-bearing and persisting for varying lengths of time (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

trichocyte field.definition: group of trichocytes on thallus surface interspersed with normal vegetative cells, e.g. hydrolithon cruciatum (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

trichogyne.definition: receptive apical prolongation of the carpogonium. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

trichoid.definition: erect and filamentous; contrasting with peltoid. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

trichothallic.definition: a method of growth, with a meristematic region in an intercalary position, usually near the base of a filament. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

trichothallic growth.definition: the site of active cell division located between the apex and base of a filament or group of filaments, as in some brown algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

trichotomous.definition: bearing three branches at each branch point. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

trifurcate.definition: having 3 prongs that diverge from the same point. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

triphasic.definition: a life history in some advanced red algae that has 3 morphological phases gametophytic, carposporophytic, and tetrasporophytic. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

triploid.definition: having 3 sets of chromosomes (see diploid, haploid). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

triquetrous.definition: a three sided structure, triangular in cross section. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

triseriate.definition: consisting, wholly or in part, of three rows of cells in longitudinal series. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

tristichous.definition: with laterals in rows on three sides of the axis or branch. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

tristromatic.definition: composed of three layers of cells. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

true hairs.definition: as in phaeophycean hairs (versus pseudohairs). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

truncate.definition: with the end abruptly flattened as if cut off. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

ts.definition: transverse section. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

tubercle.definition: small swellings or warty outgrowths. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

tubular.definition: hollow cylindrical shape. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

tuft.definition: a group of closely packed filaments attached at a single basal point that is not within a sheath. turbinate. top-shaped or inversely conical. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

turbinate.definition: inversely conical, with a contraction towards the point. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

turf.definition: a dense layer of short upright shoots arising from prostrate bases, as in a lawn. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

type.definition: the specimen on which a species (or lesser category) is based (see holotype, isotype), or the species name which provides the basis of the genus; similarly for higher taxa. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

that element to which the name of a taxon is permanently attached, whether as a correct name or as a synonym. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

type location.definition: the geographic locality where a species was first described. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

ultrastructure.definition: the submicroscopic structure of cells as shown in the electron microscope. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

umbilicate.definition: with a navel. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

uncinate.definition: hook-like. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

unconsolidated.definition: thallus in which basal filaments are not contiguous (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

undulate.definition: having a wavy surface. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

uniaxial.definition: a thallus with a single central (axial) filament (cf. multiaxial). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

unicell.definition: single-celled organism. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
one cell; a single-celled organism. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

unicellular.definition: single cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

uniflagellate.definition: with a single flagellum. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

unilateral.definition: on one side only. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).
one-sided or with branches that only arise on one side of an axis. ^ (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

unilateral branching.definition: branches only arising on one side (longitudinally) along the main axis- i.e. either originating on or all turned towards one side (cf. bilateral, secund & unilateral) (source: Algaebase (2021-05)).

unilocular.definition: containing a single loculus or cell, said of reproductive organs. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

unilocular sporangium.definition: a reproductive organ that contains a single locule (cell) and produces unispores through meiosis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

uninucleate.definition: containing only a single nucleus (e.g. fig. 31d). (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

unipolar.definition: having one pole from which development occurs. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

uniporate.definition: a red algal conceptacle having a single exit pore. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

uniseriate.definition: occurring in a single row or layer. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).
cells arranged in a single row; also a filament that is one cell in width. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

unisexual.definition: with only one sex in any one individual or within one reproductive structure (e.g. a conceptacle). (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

unispore.definition: an asexual spore produced from a unilocular sporangium and resulting from meiosis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

unispores.definition: a spore produced from a unilocular sporangium. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

unistratose.definition: composed of single cell layer; cf. bistratose (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

urceolate.definition: urn- or pitcher-shaped. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

utricle.definition: a swollen apex of a coenocytic filament (e.g., codium) or cell. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

vacuole.definition: internal space within the cytoplasm, which is bounded by a membrane and normally contains fluids. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

variety.definition: a taxon below the level of a species or subspecies. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

vegetative.definition: cells or tissue produced by mitosis and not associated with sexual reproduction (cf. sterile). vein. a small branch originating from a midrib or slightly thickened narrow region within a blade. veinlet. a small vein-like structure. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

veil.definition: thin layer of white cells shed by some conceptacles; in melobesiodeae (see phymatolithon lenormandii); cf. cortical disc (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

veins.definition: parallel or radiating thickenings or differentiated cell rows in blade or flattened axis. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

ventral.definition: lower; cf. dorsal (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

verrucose.definition: covered with tubercles or warts; warty or wart-like. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

vertical section.definition: in crustose algae, the typical type of section made. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

verticil.definition: a whorl of branches; arranged in whorls. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

verticillate.definition: whorled (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

vesicle.definition: a small, thin-walled, hollow vesicle (e.g., floats, pneumatocysts). (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

vesicular.definition: having the form of a small bladder-like sac. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

vestigial.definition: structure only partly-formed and apparently non-functional. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

virgate.definition: long and straight like a wand. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

voucher specimen.definition: a herbarium specimen kept as documentation for an identification reported in the literature. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

wall.definition: any covering around the cell. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

whorl.definition: a ring or verticil of structures around an axis. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

whorl-branch.definition: one branch of a whorl or pair of branches of limited growth. (source: Maggs, C., & Hommersand, M. H. (1993). Seaweeds of the British Isles. Volume 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3A Ceramiales.).

whorled.definition: with lateral branches arising in a ring around the main axis. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Fletcher, R. L. (1987). Seaweeds of the British Isles, Vol. 3. Fucophyceae. Part 1.(Phaeophyceae).).

whorled branching.definition: many branches (3 or more) that arise in all directions from a main stalk and are in a circle around an axis. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

wing.definition: a flat, lateral protrusion of an intergeniculum; in corallinoideae (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

wrack.definition: a tangle of drift seaweeds on the shore; also a common name for fucoid brown algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

xanthophyll.definition: carotenoid pigments that are fat soluble; reflect yellow, orange, or red light; and contain oxygenated hydrocarbons. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

xanthophylls.definition: oxygenated hydrocarbons derived from the carotenes, found in plastids as accessory photosynthetic pigments. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

xylan.definition: any group of polysaccharides composed of a central chain of linked xylose residues with other monosaccharides attached as single units or side chains. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

zigzag.definition: veering to right and left alternately; also twisting. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

zoid.definition: a motile reproductive cell, either a spore or gamete. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

zoidangium.definition: the structure producing or containing zooids. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

zonal.definition: arranged in layers, concentric zones, or parallel divisions. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

zonate.definition: linear arrangement of four spores in tetrasporangium (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

zonate tetrasporangia.definition: an elongate tetrasporangium with 3 parallel walls separating 4 spores. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

zonation.definition: the horizontal banding or zoning of organisms in the intertidal or subtidal regions, dependent on environmental and biotic factors. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).

zoned thallus.definition: see introduction 8.4 (source: Irvine, L.M., & Chamberlain, Y.M. (1994). Seaweeds of the British Isles Vol 1: Rhodophyta; Part 2B Corallinales, Hildenbrandiales.).

zooid.definition: a motile reproductive cell with flagella. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

zoosporangium.definition: a sporangium producing zoospores. (source: Womersley, H. B. S. (1987). The marine benthic flora of Southern Australia, Part II. Adelaide.).
a sporangium that produces zoospores. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

zoospore.definition: a flagellated, asexual spore capable of swimming. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

zygote.definition: the product of fusion of two gametes, before it has undergone mitosis or meiosis. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

zygotosporangium.definition: a sporangium resulting from the mitotic divisions of the zygote giving regularly arranged packets of diploid cells, i.e. zygoteospores. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

a sporangium formed by cell division in a fertilized carpogonium of porphyra and other bangialean red algae; it is not produced from gonimoblastic filaments. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).

zygotospore.definition: a diploid cell resulting from a zygote formed in a zygotosporangium and germinating into conchocelis. (source: Brodie, J.A., & Irvine, L.M. (2003) Seaweeds of the British Isles - Vol. 1 Rhodophyta, Part 3B Bangiophycidae.).

zygotospores.definition: nonmotile diploid spores resulting from a zygote formed in zygotosporangia and germinating into conchocelis filaments in porphyra and related bangialean red algae. (source: Mathieson, A. C., & Dawes, C. J. (2017). Seaweeds of the northwest Atlantic.).
